III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth
on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 4/7/24, Youth A was physically restrained in his room by Staff
1. The staff punched Youth A in the nose 3 times and put Youth A
in a choke hold. Youth A had a resulting nosebleed. Youth A did
not complain of pain or receive medical care.
Investigation This complaint was received on 04/09/2024 and assigned for joint
investigation with MDHHS Specialist.
Interviews:
All the following interviews were conducted at the facility on
04/09/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Specialist.
Administrator reported there was an incident on 04/07/2024
involving Youth A being restrained due to attacking staff. Youth A
had been self-harming earlier in the day, so staff took some items
out of his room and that’s when Youth A attacked staff.
Administrator reported Youth A was restrained in his bedroom and
there are no cameras in the bedrooms.
Youth A has been at the facility for one month. Youth A reported
he was restrained a couple of days ago. He was restrained by
Staff 1 and Staff 2. Youth A said on the day in question he was
feeling very anxious, and so he asked to go outside. Youth A was
told not to go outside, but he still went outside. Staff 1 came
outside and told him he had to go back inside. When he came
back, he found that staff had removed his pencils from his room.
Youth A became mad and questioned Staff 1 about the items
removed from his room. Youth A admitted he pushed Staff 1 and
that’s when Staff 1 restrained him. Youth A said he blacked out for
a few minutes and does not remember everything that happened.
2

Youth A said he has good rapport with Staff 1 and Staff 2 and
does not believe the staff punched him but thinks when Staff 1
lifted his hand to put him in a restraint his hand hit his nose. Youth
A admitted he hit and pushed Staff 1 several times when Staff 1
was trying to restrain him. Youth A said Staff 2 came in his
bedroom and assisted Staff 1 with the restraint. Youth A said his
nose started to bleed and he got a scab on the left side of his neck
and thinks that was caused by Staff 1’s glove during the restraint.
Youth A denied he was choked or put in a chokehold during the
restraint. Youth A said he didn’t require medical attention, his nose
stopped bleeding, and he felt fine. Youth A admitted he had self-
harmed in the past and it had been several weeks since he self-
harmed. Youth A said he talked to Staff 1 after the restraint, and
he apologized to Staff 1. Youth A said he has good rapport with all
the staff, and he has never had any issues with Staff 1 or any
other staff.
Youth B has been at the facility for 2 months and is on the same
unit with Youth A. Youth B recalled the incident involving Youth A.
He said Youth A was upset because Staff 1 told Youth A it was
late, and he could not go outside. Youth B said he didn’t witness
Youth A being restrained because it happened in Youth A’s
bedroom. He said Staff 1 and Staff 2 were in the bedroom with
Youth A. Youth B heard that Youth A got a nosebleed after the
restraint. Youth B said it is common for Youth A to get
nosebleeds, because sometimes when they play basketball Youth
A’s nose will start to bleed. Youth B reported he feels safe at the
facility and has never witnessed staff to choke or push any of the
youths.
Youth C is on the same unit with Youth A. Youth C said he heard
that Youth A was restrained but did not witness Youth A being
restrained. Youth A said he saw Staff 1 and Staff 2 go into Youth
A’s bedroom but did not witness Youth A being restrained. Youth
C has never been restrained. Youth C reported he feels safe at
the facility and did not express any concerns regarding the staff.
Therapist reported Youth A has a history of self-harming and the
day in question she was informed that Youth A was self-harming
with sharp objects. Staff did remove his pencils from his bedroom,
because Youth A was on observation three weeks ago for self-
harming. She was not working on the day of the restraint, but she
spoke with Youth A the following day and he reported he was
punched in the face three times by Staff 1 and got a bloody nose.
Youth A told her staff did give him paper towel and provided first
aid for his nose.
3

Administrator reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 have been placed on
administrative leave pending the investigations. Administrator said
Staff 1 and Staff 2 do not have any disciplinary actions and both
staff completed CPI refresher course this past February.
Administrator reported Youth A’s pencils were removed from his
room, because Youth A was anxious, and staff were concerned
about him self-harming. Youth A was previously on observation for
self-harming. Administrator said staff attempted to verbally des-
escalate Youth A, but he assaulted staff and therefore he was
restrained. Administrator said Youth A initially reported he was
punched in the face by Staff 1 but has changed his story multiple
times about what happened. Staff 1 provided Youth A with first
aid for the nosebleed and asked if he needed medical care and
Youth A refused. Administrator is not aware of Youth A having a
nosebleed prior to this incident.
I interviewed Staff 1 via telephone, in collaboration with MDHHS
Specialist who was present at the facility. Staff reported on
04/07/2024 Youth A went outside without permission, so he went
outside and got Youth A to go back to the unit. Youth A went to his
room and found that his pencils were removed from his room.
Youth A became mad, Staff 1 tried to talk to Youth A and calm him
down, but Youth A became more escalated, so Staff 1 and Staff 2
attempted to put Youth A in a standing restraint. Youth A started
hitting, pushing, and head butted them, so they released the hold
on Youth A. He and Staff 2 tried to talk to Youth A, but he
continued to be aggressive, so they again attempted a 2nd
restraint and for approximately 30 seconds. Youth A did calm
down, and they released the hold. Staff 1 said he did notice Youth
A's nose was bleeding and he provided him with first aid. He
asked Youth A multiple times if he needed anything, and Youth A
said he was fine. Staff 1 said Youth A apologized and admitted
that he was wrong for pushing and punching Staff 1. He asked
Youth A to write a statement about the incident and that’s when
Youth A changed his story and said that he was hit and choked.
Staff 1 denied choking or punching Youth A. Staff 1 said he did
not observe any bruises or injuries on Youth A and Youth A
refused medical attention. Staff 1 said he has a good rapport with
Youth A and that he is usually able to get Youth A to calm down
verbally, but he is not sure what was going on with Youth A that
evening. This was the first time Staff 1 had to restrain Youth A.
I interviewed Staff 2 via telephone, in collaboration with MDHHS
Specialist who was in person at the facility. Staff 2 reported on
04/07/2024 Youth A had left the unit without permission, so Staff 1
4

followed Youth A and got him to return to the unit. Youth A went to
his bedroom and Staff 1 followed Youth A. Youth A became more
escalated when he found out that some items were removed from
his bedroom, so Staff 1 attempted to verbally deescalate Youth A.
Youth A became more aggressive, so Staff 2 went to assist Staff
1. Staff 2 said Youth A pushed and hit Staff 1 in the chest, so she
and Staff 1 attempted to put Youth A in a team control restraint.
She and Staff 1 struggled to hold Youth A and that’s when the
bedroom door closed. Youth A continued to struggle during the
restraint, so they released the hold. Youth A continued to be
escalated and aggressive, they attempted a second team control
hold for less than one minute and released the hold once Youth A
calmed down. She and Staff 1 debriefed with Youth A after the
incident and Youth A was asked why he attacked Staff 1 and
Youth A said he “blacked out” and does not know why he lashed
out on Staff 1. She denied Staff 1 punched or put Youth A in a
chokehold. Staff 1 said Youth A was offered first aid for the
nosebleed. Staff 1 did not observe any marks or bruises on Youth
A from being restrained.
A predisposition conference was held with MDHHS Specialist on
05/07//2024. There is no finding by MDHHS Specialist.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the facility occurred on 04/09/2024. The living room was
observed, which leads to Youth A’s bedroom where Youth A was
restrained. When standing in the living room the inside of Youth
A’s bedroom is visible.
Video Reviewed:
The video footage date is 04/07/2024 at approximately 8 pm.
(video has no audio) Staff 1 is standing in the doorway of Youth
A’s bedroom and Staff 2 is also observed standing outside the
bedroom. Youth A is seen pushing Staff 1. Staff 1 and Staff 2
enter the bedroom, and the bedroom door is closed.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 04/07/2024 at approximately 7:50 pm,
written by Staff 2. Incident type is aggressive behavior.
Incident report is consistent with Staff 2’s interview.
• Behavior Management Policy and Procedures states,
Physical behavior management intervention is used only
when it is assessed a youth is at risk of imminent harm to
themselves or others. The CPI Crisis Development Model
documents that staff learning appropriate and effective
approaches to crisis behaviors presented by youth. Staff's
responses are outlined and range from de-escalation to
5

physical restraint, physical management is the last option
after staff have exhausted all other efforts to de-escalate
the youth and they remain a danger to themselves or
others. Report of the restraint must be completed within 12
hours.
• Personnel files for Staff 1 and Staff 2. Staff 1 and Staff 2
completed nonviolent crisis intervention training on
02/29/2024. Staff 1 and Staff 2 do not have any disciplinary
reports.
Analysis The facility is compliant with the rule as there is insufficient
evidence that Youth A was put in a choke hold and/or punched.
Youth A initially reported he was punched and choked during the
restraint, but when interviewed he denied being punched in the
face or choked. Youth A admitted to being aggressive and hitting
and punching staff. Inconsistent with what was initially reported,
the staff stated Youth A hit, punched and head butted them, and
thus, was physically restrained. Youth A’s nose bled briefly
afterward. However, it could not be determined what caused his
nose to bleed.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
